alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 4:19PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Humboldt County through 500 PM PDT... At 418 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 19 miles east of Paradise Valley, moving southwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Paradise Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
